title: Ticket #5786: Fix build on Mac OS X 10.11 El Capitan
description:
The version of Xcode for Mac OS X 10.11 (El Capitan) stopped including the header files for OpenSSL, although the libraries are still included with the OS. This breaks the HTCondor build, which relies on the the OpenSSL provided by Apple.

As a short-term fix, we can take the header files from version 10.10 and use them for builds on 10.11.

Longer term, we need to find another solution, as the OpenSSL libraries included with the OS are old. We can either switch to Apple's Mac-specific TLS interface (called Secure Transport) or build our own copy of OpenSSL and distribute the libraries as part of the release.
